intro: Rostkovia gracilis, commonly known as the slender rostkovia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Rostkovia gracilis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and historical use in herbal medicine.
